column4: anyone have beagle working with evolution with exchange as backend server?
I think I do.  I use exchange as my backend.
does it index your email?  it not grabbing mine
unclear.  Some email (like ones I've sent are indexed), but new read mail doesn't appear to be.  Beagle does beat on my cpu indexing stuff right now.
could also be that email is found via the thunderbird route too I suppose.  Evo uses exchange backend, thunderbird uses imap to exchange.
odd.  i'm running beagle-status in a terminal while i'm working.  only thing it seems to be picking up are webpages.  no email
beagle is busy with the gaim logs (seems suboptimal)  If I exchange irc chat it calms down.
beagle is finding a bunch of my email via thunderbird (via IMAP),
yup.  i just created an imap connection with thunderbird and it's indexing everything
odd.  i see posts on various sites that say beagle works with evolution and exchange as a connector
don't see email I've read only with evolution (except email I've sent) which is on the local disk.  Doesn't seem to look at stuff on exchange inbox
I leave my email on the server.
hm.  i'm on a laptop.. so i do archive a copy locally (still ont he server)
I suppose if you want to.  I just leave stuff there and not pull it to the laptop.
I've used evolution for years and still my favorite command a few times a day is:            `locate killev`
i found an irc chan dedicated to it from the faq on the website.  checking on it now
the official answer is NO.. it does not work @ this time
